bibl.title: Letter from Vernon W. Lippard to Philip Showalter Hench, November 26, 1952

div1.p: Lippard thanks Hench for representing the University of Virginia Medical School at the Camp Lazear dedication.

div1.head: Letter from Vernon W. Lippard to Philip Showalter Hench, November 26, 1952
div1.opener:
D
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
DEPARTMENT OF MEDICINE
CHARLOTTESVILLE
November 26, 1952
OFFICE OF THE DEAN
Reed
Moran
Kean
Cooke
add Cooke
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you for your telegram of November 24 and note
received today regarding the University of Virginia ribbon.
I am unable to locate the appropriate ribbon in time for
it to reach you before the ceremonies, but I should think
that one strip of orange ribbon and one strip of blue
ribbon attached to the wreath would be appropriate.

I cannot tell you how much we appreciate the effort
you have made to include the University of Virginia in
the ceremonies and I regret that a member of our faculty
cannot be present. I have received an invitation to the
ceremonies and have replied with greetings and regrets
that I cannot be present but that you will represent us
in the presentation of the wreath.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Vernon W. Lippard, M. D.
